issues.description: The problem description inconsistently refers to a method named `getFeedingSound()` in multiple places (e.g. lines 97–100) while the UML and test specifications define and expect an abstract method `messageOnFeed()` on `Animal`. This naming mismatch can confuse students about which method to implement and lead to compilation or test failures.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the method name across the description, UML, template, and tests. For example, replace all occurrences of `getFeedingSound()` in the problem statement with `messageOnFeed()`, or vice versa update the UML and solution to use `getFeedingSound()` consistently.

issues.description: The problem statement’s narrative tasks refer to the feeding sound method as getFeedingSound(), but the UML and solution implementation use messageOnFeed(). This inconsistency can confuse students about which method name to implement.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the problem statement’s narrative tasks with the UML and solution by renaming all references to getFeedingSound() to messageOnFeed().
